page.title: 08Walgrave Primary School
page.content: In our school we have 5 classes.There are 128 children aged 4-11. The main block was built in 1910.It is built of red brick and it has 3 classrooms,the junior toilets, the hall,the office, the staffroom,a small library and a wet area (for art). The infant block was not built until after World War 2.That is made of brick and is covered in plaster,it is painted yellow.The infant block holds 2 classrooms and the infant toilets. We also have a wildlife area for all sorts of insects. Our swimming pool is built on the school grounds and is usually used by the pupils.The pool is 1 metre deep and is covered with a plastic dome. Pupils come from the villages of Old, Hannington, Holcot and Walgrave. 1985 is the 75th anniversary of the school.
